Description: Textile fragments of mummy bandage; two strips of linen torn from the same textile, densely woven, medium quality, undyed, now varying in colour from dark cream to grey-brown, with oily stains and black smudges. b is cleaner than a. Sides torn, ends cut or ragged. Tied around a, a piece of pinkish cotton tape, modern. At one end of a, a 19th century ink inscription: 'Roller 6 yds long/ slit at both ends/ and with selvage at both sides'. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spliced and S-twisted; the stitch gauge is warp c.22-23 ends per 10mm and weft c.10-12 picks per 10mm. The modern tape: The threads are Z-twisted cotton; the stitch gauge is warp c.23 ends per 10mm and weft c.18 picks per 10mm. Length in total is c.32 cm.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville
Acquisition notes: EA 75997-75999 and 76001 were all wrapped in paper labelled in ink in a 19th century hand, 'Mummy Rollers', and in pencil 'Dr Granville'. Probably from the mummy of Irtyersenu, unwrapped by A B Granville in 1821.
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: Unregistered textile 2508 a, b
